name: Chevy Spark App

questions.title: EV
questions.question: What does EV stand for?
questions.correctText: EV stands for "Electric Vehicle." Although, sometimes it should stand for "Early Vacation," too.
questions.incorrectText: EV stands for "Electric Vehicle." Although, sometimes it should stand for "Early Vacation," too.

questions.title: 240V Charging System
questions.question: The available 240V charging system charges the Spark EV from empty to full in 12 hours.
questions.correctText: It only takes 7 hours to get a full charge with the available 240V charging system, and Spark EV owners and lessees are eligible for up to a $500 discount on toward the purchase of a 240V charger from Bosch.
questions.incorrectText: It only takes 7 hours to get a full charge with the available 240V charging system, and Spark EV owners and lessees are eligible for up to a $500 discount on toward the purchase of a 240V charger from Bosch.

questions.title: Torque
questions.question: Torque is what makes your car get up and go when you hit the  accelerator.
questions.correctText: And the Spark EV gets 400 lb.-ft of instant torque, more than a Ferrari 458 Italia
questions.incorrectText: It's true! And the Spark EV gets 400 lb.-ft of instant torque, more than a Ferrari 458 Italia.

questions.title: Regenerative Braking
questions.question: What's so special about regenerative brakes?
answers: They capture energy lost while braking
They are brakes that can be charged
questions.correctText: Regenerative brakes capture energy lost while braking, helping you go further on a single charge.
questions.incorrectText: Regenerative brakes capture energy lost while braking, helping you go further on a single charge.

questions.title: Zero Emissions
questions.question: What does "zero emissions" even mean?
answers: Zero pollutants put into the air by a source (like from a vehicle's tailpipe)
An explorer who hasn't gone on any missions
questions.correctText: "Zero emissions" refers to zero pollutants put into the air by a source â€“ like the Spark EV, which gives you an average of 82 miles of driving with zero emissions.
questions.incorrectText: "Zero emissions" refers to zero pollutants put into the air by a source â€“ like the Spark EV, which gives you an average of 82 miles of driving with zero emissions.

questions.title: MPGe
questions.question: What does MPGe stand for?
questions.correctText: Miles Per Gallon of Gasoline-Equivalent was formulated by the EPA as a method of comparing fuel economy across all types of vehicles. MPGe calculates the number of miles a vehicle can go using the same amount of energy found in a gallon of gasoline.
questions.incorrectText: Miles Per Gallon of Gasoline-Equivalent was formulated by the EPA as a method of comparing fuel economy across all types of vehicles. MPGe calculates the number of miles a vehicle can go using the same amount of energy found in a gallon of gasoline.
